title: What Does Lead Poisoning Do To Your Brain?

multiple-choice.question: What is lead, and what are its effects on the human body?

options.label: A
options.text: Lead is a highly poisonous element that can cause rashes, abdominal pain, and anemia.

options.label: B
options.text: Lead is a malleable and durable element used in piping and paint.

options.label: C
options.text: Lead is a naturally occurring element that can cause headaches and memory loss.

options.label: D

options.text: Adults are more susceptible to lead poisoning.

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: To weaken the connections between neurons.

options.label: C
options.text: To help neurons recover from lead exposure.

options.label: C
